hero.title: Democracy Earth Protocol

hero.quote: Democracy isn't a place you visit‚Äîit's a protocol you run. Fork it. Remix it. Make it yours.

identity.title: Authentication Method
identity.heading: How Should Voters Authenticate? üîê
identity.subtitle: Choose which authentication method voters must use to participate in this election.
identity.emailDesc: Voters sign in with email and password. Simple and familiar for everyone. üìß
identity.phoneDesc: Voters verify their identity with SMS verification code. Secure mobile auth. üì±
identity.googleDesc: Voters sign in with their Google account. Fast and convenient OAuth login. üîë
identity.worldIdDesc: Voters verify using World ID proof-of-humanity. Crypto-native identity verification. üåê
identity.outputDesc: Your selection determines which authentication provider voters must use to access the voting page.

voting.title: Voting Logic
voting.heading: How Should Voting Work? ‚öôÔ∏è
voting.subtitle: Pick a template or let AI cook up custom rules. Democracy, your way.
voting.aiPromptPlaceholder: Example: Make a quadratic vote where people get 100 points to split across issues. The more you spend on one thing, the less powerful each point becomes. Keep it anonymous but verifiable. Basically, democracy that can't be gamed.

direct.title: Direct Democracy
direct.description: Classic. One person = one vote. Majority rules. üëä
direct.prompt: Create a direct democracy voting system where each person gets exactly one vote with equal weight. Simple majority wins. Every vote counts the same, no delegation, no complexity. This is pure one-person-one-vote democracy.

liquid.title: Liquid Voting
liquid.description: Too busy? Delegate to someone you trust. Democracy on autopilot. üåä
liquid.prompt: Build a liquid democracy system where voters can either vote directly OR delegate their voting power to someone they trust. Delegates can further delegate to others, creating a chain of trust. Voters can revoke delegation and vote directly at any time. Track delegation chains and prevent circular delegation loops.

quadratic.title: Quadratic Voting
quadratic.description: Spread your power across issues. Math that fights extremism. üìä
quadratic.prompt: Implement quadratic voting where each voter receives a fixed number of credits (e.g., 100 points) to distribute across multiple issues. The cost of votes increases quadratically: 1 vote = 1 credit, 2 votes = 4 credits, 3 votes = 9 credits, etc. This allows voters to express preference intensity while preventing vote concentration on single issues.

ranked.title: Ranked Choice Voting
ranked.description: Rank candidates by preference. If no majority, lowest is eliminated and votes redistribute until someone wins. üî¢
ranked.prompt: Create a ranked choice voting system where voters rank candidates in order of preference (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.). If no candidate receives a majority of first-preference votes, eliminate the candidate with the fewest votes and redistribute their votes to the next preference. Repeat until a candidate achieves a majority. This ensures the winner has broad support and reduces strategic voting.

token.title: Token Voting
token.description: Web3-powered voting using blockchain tokens. On-chain governance. ü™ô
token.prompt: Implement token-based voting where voting power is determined by the number of governance tokens held by each voter. Integrate with Web3 wallets for authentication. Each token represents one vote. Support delegation and on-chain vote recording for transparency and immutability.

exampleList: Quadratic voting with 100 points per voter
Delegative democracy with liquid vote transfers
Reputation-weighted voting based on contribution history

liquidDelegation.title: Allow Liquid Delegation
liquidDelegation.description: Enable voters to delegate their voting power to trusted representatives who can vote on their behalf.

voting.outputDesc: Smart contract ABI or JSON logic definition will be generated based on your selection.

bill.title: Bill & Certification
bill.singleChoiceDesc: Voters can select only one option.
